items.title: A NEW CRASH ADVENTURE, ON MOBILE!
Crash Bandicoot N-Sane Trilogy Switch review
Is Crash spindashing back into our hearts?
Crash Bandicoot Mobile, King's action-packed runner, has soft-launched for Android

content1.text: In Crash Bandicoot: On the Run!™ , Dr. Neo Cortex has dispatched iconic villains across the multiverse to take control of all dimensions. With the help of his sister Coco, Crash must bash Cortex's minions back to their own dimensions!
Use Crash's unstoppable energy and let the fur fly as you run, spin and slide your way to stop the dastardly Dr. Neo Cortex from destroying all worlds.

content2.text: Crash Bandicoot Mobile is a brand new Crash Bandicoot experience from legendary mobile developer King, of Candy Crush fame. They've clearly pulled out all the stops on this game, and this is, both in terms of visuals and gameplay, a world away from the likes of Candy Crush and other match-3 puzzlers.

content3.text: This game looks good, with levels that evoke the designs of the original PlayStation game. It has some F2P mobile mechanics, as you might expect, but it's incredibly easy to ignore those frustrations in the early game. Things only get complicated after you've made a decent amount of progress…

content4.text: But that's exactly why you're here, right? In this guide we're going to run through some of the tips that Crash Bandicoot Mobile doesn't outright tell you, so you can make progress fast. This game is currently in Soft Launch, but you can find a .apk file if you know where to find one safely.

content5.text: Popular mobile game publisher King has finally confirmed the Crash Bandicoot: On the Run release date – and it’s not too far off at all. This colourful endless runner will hit iOS and Android on March 25, which is a mere few weeks away.
